intro: Peristylus djampangensis, commonly known as the Djampangensis Peristylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid, shaded environments with high biodiversity. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
